intro: Keteleeria cyclolepis, commonly known as the Chinese fir, is a coniferous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its needle-like leaves and cones, typical of the Cupressaceae family. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall and is often found in mountainous regions. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing some resistance to pests and diseases. Keteleeria cyclolepis plays an important role in forest ecosystems and is valued for its timber.
